reviews.review_msg: This class was fun and interesting.  It's fast paced and you learn a ton of grammar and important vocabularies.  Same textbook used for the next level.  Highly recommend Dr. Hein!
Very kind and compassionate. She's willing to give help and always works with you when needed. Organization of some assignments can be a bit messy though.

One of the VERY BEST professors I've ever had at SFU. She makes everything fun and engaging. Very understanding prof and goes out of her way to help! She has a good sense of humour as well. Just memorize the vocab for each lesson and the tests are designed for a beginner's level! Highly recommend if you get the chance.

Claudia is easily one of my favourite professors at SFU, she cares about her students and makes learning a new language fun and engaging. The class has vocab quizzes almost every class but if you study for these it helps translate to the tests. As long as you put in the effort to learning and practicing you should do well.

Awesome prof! Very nice and friendly, very clear, easy A if you do the homework (vocab tests every week, excercises, participation, 4 big tests, no papers, no final). Fun class (music, games, group works).

Claudia was great! Very engaging prof, lots of cultural knowledge since she's actually German. Easy marks from daily vocab quizzes. Learn the vocab, attend class, ask questions if you don't understand a point and you'll do fine. She is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

Really nice lady, and wants her class to do well. However, I find that she does not spend enough time going over the important things and she rushes through every lesson and spends more time on useless things. It made for tests to be extremely difficult because she didn't thoroughly go over what we needed to know the most. Not a bad class though.
One of the BEST Prof in my entire SFU life!

Awesome prof!  Well, actually, I had her one time as a sub since Suzanne was sick or something and she was greeeeat! ~  She seems to enjoy her job lol.  I look forward to taking more german cuz of her A+++

GREAT PROF! lots of interaction with classmates! learn thru games and interviewing other people! Quizzes are easy! Tests are not hard! Homework online, question on facebook, and two exercises in book. Oral exam not hard at all, 5minutes. CLASS is actually fun! German lot of similarities to English (words+Grammar) taking Germ103 if she is teaching

SHE IS GREAT! Class is exciting and fun. Learn German by doing activities like interviewing other people with Deutsch. Lots of interaction with classmates! Board games, card games, etc. E-tutor easy. Quizzes and test straight forward. Oral Exam is only 5min long. Will definitely recommend her. plus, the Deutsch is very similar to English!!!!

My favourite teacher so far at SFU. Extremely enthusiastic and helpful. Emphasizes spoken German, which, although intimidating, is extremely helpful. Engaging and funny, makes me want to take further German courses. If I have 1 criticism, it's that she's not very good with names, but she makes a genuine effort and is very endearing.

She is AMAZING. i want to be a critic, but she didnt do ANYTHING to allow me to. She is clear,extremely helpful, easy to learn from, funny and charming, she engages the class... This class took alot of work, but she made every bit of it enjoyable! I almost got stuck with a TA learning to teach, but switching to her actual class was SO worth it!

Very impressed with Claudia's constant enthusiasm in teaching & helping students in & outside class. I always felt motivated to go to class. Very easy-going, which encouraged me to constantly ask loads of questions (which are essential if you want to learn the language well!).  Claudia ist ausgezeichnet! :)

Pretty much....Claudia was/is the best prof I have ever had. Sfu really sucks for profs(REALLY!) but Claudia made those semesters of absolute hell a little brighter. If you get into the class, and study just a tiny bit I guarantee you'll have a blast and possibly get a nice GPA boosting mark. (Hint: flashcards!)

Claudia is the best languages professor I've ever had. She explains things in a clear and precise manner, making it easy to understand the difficult grammar concepts. As to favourtism, she's obviously going to favour her daughter. Also, she believes her daughter is better at German than her university students, which she is.

Claudia is really the best prof. in SFU!! She is so funny, easy-going and super friendly. The way she teaches is so encourging and easy-to-understand. You will love her if you take her classes! She is super awesome! I just cant believe SFU has such a great prof! :)

Claudia is the best prof in SFU! She's so nice and helpful! She always gives students a lot of encouragement. I took Germ 102 as a elective and I'm glad that I took this course! Definitely I'll take her Germ 103 semester!
Very laid back and fun atmosphere for learning German. She's a hard marker but you know exactly what you need to work on.
Very nice and encouraging prof. I really enjoyed her class and learned a lot. Best prof!!!

Frau Claudia is super nice, a really down to earth teacher.  She marks very critically, but it's all helpful stuff.  Overall a great teacher and makes German fun to learn. Adds a lot of insight into the culture to help us understand.
Took this course out of interest, and am very glad I did. Claudia was extremely helpful and encouraging, and just plain nice. Definitely an enjoyable class.
No Comments
You'll enjoy her class. Lots of fun!
Awesome Prof! you'll love her class!
